title: Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 Live: Launches, unveils, and more from the event - news - The Financial Express
summary:
Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 Live: Hyundai Creta EV launched at Rs 17.99 lakh, Maruti Suzuki eVitara unveiled, and Tata takes the stage with new EVs

Date: 2025

Source: Financial Express

The Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 is showcasing new electric vehicles from numerous manufacturers, including Hyundai, Maruti Suzuki, and Tata Motors.

  • Hyundai launched the Creta EV at a price of Rs 17.99 lakh.
  • Maruti Suzuki unveiled the eVitara and other upcoming models.
  • Tata showcased a range of electric vehicles including the Safari EV and Harrier EV.
  • Two-wheeler manufacturers are also present, unveiling models like the KTM 390 Adventure S and the all-electric Access scooter.
“Catch all the updates live from the 2025 Bharat Mobility Expo.”

This expo represents a significant advancement in India's electric vehicle market, emphasizing the increasing shift toward sustainable mobility.
newTitle: Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 Features New Electric Vehicles from Major Automakers

title: Jio Financial Services Q3 Results Live Updates: Should you buy Jio Finance shares ahead of Q3 results today? | Stock Market News - Mint
Kalyan Jewellers Shares Fall 37% From All-Time Highs; Why Is The Stock Losing Its Shine? - News18
summary:
Kalyan Jewellers Shares Fall 37% From All-Time Highs; Why Is The Stock Losing Its Shine?

Date: January 17, 2025
Source: News18

Shares of Kalyan Jewellers India Ltd have continued to decline despite the company denying rumors of IT raids and allegations of bribing fund managers. The stock started 2025 on a high note but has been on a downward trend, falling in 10 out of 13 sessions this year.

  • The stock dropped 6.63% on Friday, reaching a low of Rs 503.25, marking a 36.66% decline from its record high of Rs 794.60.
  • The stock has fallen in four out of five sessions this week.
  • Kalyan Jewellers is currently in "oversold" territory, with a Relative Strength Index (RSI) at 21.
  • The market capitalization has dropped from over Rs 82,000 crore to Rs 50,000 crore.
  • The company denied allegations of IT raids and labeled bribery rumors as “absurd.”
  • Recent financial measures include repayments of around Rs 450 crore of debt and a Rs 170 crore dividend payout.
  • The stock is approaching a key support level of Rs 515.
  • Kalyan Jewellers shares have delivered a positive return of 39% over the past year, with multibagger returns of 320% and 626% over two and three years, respectively.
“We have always maintained a high level of integrity and transparency in our business operations.” - Ramesh Kalyanaraman, executive director.

This decline in stock price indicates potential challenges for Kalyan Jewellers, despite past success and positive returns in a longer timeframe. Investors are advised to approach cautiously and stay updated on future developments.
newTitle: Kalyan Jewellers Shares Fall 37% From All-Time Highs; Why Is The Stock Losing Its Shine?

title: Deepinder Goyal vows ‘such s**t doesn’t happen’ on Zomato in apology to Bengaluru man - Hindustan Times
Tech Mahindra Q3 Results: Cons PAT soars 93% YoY to Rs 983 crore, revenue up 1% - The Economic Times
summary:
Tech Mahindra Q3 Results: Cons PAT soars 93% YoY to Rs 983 crore, revenue up 1%

Publication Date: January 19, 2025

Source: The Economic Times

Tech Mahindra has reported a remarkable 93% growth in consolidated net profit for Q3FY25, reaching Rs 983 crore. While revenue from operations saw a slight increase, there was a sequential decline in profits.

  • Consolidated net profit of Rs 983 crore for Q3FY25.
  • Revenue from operations increased by 1.4% to Rs 13,286 crore.
  • The company achieved TCV growth of 95.4% in new deals, totaling $745 million.
  • Sequentially, profits declined by 21% from Q2FY25.
  • EBITDA rose to Rs 1,809 crore, marking a 57.8% increase YoY.
The company witnessed an improved rate of deal wins in its key verticals, according to CEO Mohit Joshi.

The impressive annual growth in profit reflects Tech Mahindra’s strong performance in the IT services sector despite some sequential challenges.
newTitle: Tech Mahindra Reports 93% YoY Growth in Q3 Profit

Honda has finally unveiled the prices for its new Activa e: model at the Bharat Mobility Auto Expo 2025, set at Rs 1.17 lakh (ex-showroom).

  • New electric Activa model launched.
  • Price set at Rs 1.17 lakh.
  • Equipped with two swappable 1.5 kWh batteries.
  • Offers a range of 102 km.
  • Top speed of 80 kmph with 0-60 sprint in 7.3 seconds.
  • Three riding modes: Eco, Standard, Sport.
  • Features LED headlamp, touchscreen, and advanced connected tech.
“The new Activa e: sprints 0-60 in 7.3 seconds.”

The electric Honda Activa introduces significant features and aims to appeal to environmentally conscious consumers while maintaining its iconic design.

title: Axis Bank, Bajaj Electricals among 33 stocks to hit 52-week low today; check full list - Upstox
summary:
Axis Bank, Bajaj Electricals Among 33 Stocks to Hit 52-Week Low Today

Publication Date: January 17, 2024

Source: National Stock Exchange of India (NSE)

As many as 33 stocks hit their lowest levels in 52 weeks on the NSE amid a negative trading environment. Notable stocks include Axis Bank and Bajaj Electricals, which both reported significant declines due to various factors, including weak earnings and tax issues.

  • Axis Bank Ltd: 52-week low of ₹974.6; shares fell 6.1% after weak quarterly earnings.
  • Bajaj Electricals Ltd: 52-week low of ₹719.1; shares down 1.7% due to tax demand decision.
  • Relaxo Footwears Ltd: 52-week low of ₹569.5; shares declined 1.3% amid ongoing drops in the market.
“Axis Bank’s growth in advances and deposits for the quarter was the slowest in the last 15 quarters.”

In addition to Axis Bank and Bajaj Electricals, other stocks similarly affected include HIL Ltd, Jai Balaji Industries Ltd, and Relaxo Footwears Ltd.
newTitle: Axis Bank, Bajaj Electricals Among 33 Stocks to Hit 52-Week Low Today

title: Bharat Moblity | Auto Expo 2025 live updates: Maruti Suzuki e Vitara unveiled, Creta EV launch coming up - HT Auto
Hero Xpulse 210 launched at Rs 1.76 lakh at Bharat Mobility Expo 2025 - BikeWale
summary:
Hero Xpulse 210 Launched at Rs 1.76 Lakh at Bharat Mobility Expo 2025

Publication Date: Not Specified | Source: BikeWale

The Hero Xpulse 210 has been officially launched in India at a price of Rs 1.76 lakh. This new model is an upgrade from the Xpulse 200, featuring enhancements for better highway riding and off-road capabilities.

  • New adventure bike priced at Rs. 1.76 lakh.
  • More expensive than Xpulse 200 by Rs. 24,000.
  • Powered by a 210cc, single-cylinder engine with 24.6bhp and 20.7Nm torque.
  • Equipped with a six-speed gearbox and dual-sport motorcycle features.
  • Includes full LED illumination and a 4.2-inch TFT console with smartphone connectivity.
  • Braking hardware consists of front and rear disc brakes with dual-channel ABS.
  • Bookings for the two variants will start soon.
“The increment in the engine capacity and addition of the sixth gear should translate to good highway riding capabilities.”

The Hero Xpulse 210 aims to serve as an ideal option for beginner off-road enthusiasts, following the path set by its predecessor, the Xpulse 200 4V.
newTitle: Hero Xpulse 210 Launched at Rs 1.76 Lakh at Bharat Mobility Expo 2025

title: Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 Live: Maruti Suzuki eVitara unveiled! - The Financial Express
New Honda Activa Rival Finally Debuts In India! - MotorOctane
summary:
Suzuki Access Electric Debuts in India

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: MotorOctane

Honda has unveiled its new electric Activa and QC1 scooter, while Suzuki introduces its new electric Access model, marking the entry of a new competitor in the EV scooter segment.

  • The Suzuki Access Electric features a 3.07 kWh battery pack, offering a claimed range of 95 km.
  • It's powered by a 4.1 kW electric motor, achieving a top speed of 71 km/h.
  • Charging time is approximately 4 hours and 30 minutes to reach 80% and 6 hours and 42 minutes for a full charge.
  • The scooter retains a similar design to its ICE counterpart but is based on a new platform with enhanced features.
  • Smart connectivity features, 3 driving modes, and a reverse mode are included.
“The new Access Electric will rival the new Honda Activa e: and Roadster S1 in the country.”

The entry of the Suzuki Access Electric is a significant development in the growing electric scooter market in India, enhancing competition and offering more choices for consumers.
newTitle: Suzuki Access Electric Debuts in India, Competing Against Honda Activa

The Maruti Suzuki e-Vitara was unveiled at the Bharat Mobility Expo, featuring an impressive 500 km range, positioning itself as a competitor to the Creta EV.

  • The e-Vitara boasts a modern design and advanced technology features.
  • It aims to tap into the growing electric vehicle market in India.
  • The vehicle offers various charging options and quick charging capabilities.
  • Environmental impact and sustainability were key themes highlighted during its launch.

title: Trinamool's Mahua Moitra Flags Spoilt Ice Creams In Delivery, Swiggy Responds To Refund Request - NDTV
summary:
MP Mahua Moitra Addresses Spoilt Ice Cream Delivery, Swiggy Responds

Publication Date: January 16, 2025

Source: NDTV

Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra raised concerns on social media about ice creams she ordered via Swiggy that arrived spoilt. Swiggy responded quickly, asking for her order number to address the issue.

  • Mahua Moitra encountered a delivery problem with spoiled ice creams ordered from Swiggy.
  • She tweeted about her dissatisfaction and expected a refund or replacement.
  • Swiggy promptly acknowledged her complaint and requested further details.
  • The order cost was Rs 1220 for 10 items.
  • Moitra's tweets gained significant attention, prompting varied reactions from the public.
  • She defended her choice to raise the issue publicly, highlighting that MPs are regular consumers.

Hi Mahua, sorry to know that you are facing an issue with your order. Please share the order number. We will look into it.

— Swiggy Cares (@SwiggyCares)

Just because I am an MP doesn't mean I am not a normal person who orders food online. Please get over this mindset that public reps are not normal beings.

— Mahua Moitra (@MahuaMoitra)

The incident has sparked a broader discussion about online food deliveries and consumer expectations.
newTitle: MP Mahua Moitra Addresses Spoilt Ice Cream Delivery, Swiggy Responds

title: Popular 7-Seater Skoda SUV Debuts In India! - MotorOctane
summary:
Skoda Unveils New 7-Seater SUV and Superb Sedan at Auto Expo 2025 in India

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: MotorOctane

The Auto Expo 2025 kicked off with excitement as Skoda launched the new Kodiaq and Superb for the Indian market, revitalizing its lineup against strong competitors.

  • The new Superb gets a refreshed design with modern headlamps and bumpers, while maintaining its rivalry with the Toyota Camry.
  • The Kodiaq, a 7-seater SUV, competes with the popular Toyota Fortuner and MG Gloster, sporting updates to bumpers and headlamps.
  • Both models share a complete redesign of the interior, featuring a large touchscreen, updated dashboard, and premium materials.
  • Safety features include 9 airbags and advanced driver assistance systems such as automated emergency braking.
  • The Kodiaq is expected to be priced around Rs 55 lakh, while the Superb might go up to Rs 70 lakh due to its CBU import status.
“Skoda has really uplifted the premium quotient with plenty of soft-touch material.”

With the launches set for the coming months, these vehicles aim to enhance Skoda's presence in the competitive Indian SUV market.
newTitle: Skoda Unveils New 7-Seater SUV and Superb Sedan at Auto Expo 2025 in India

title: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal responds after user points out Veg Mode enablement fees in the bill - The Times of India
summary:
Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal responds after user points out Veg Mode enablement fees in the bill

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Deepinder Goyal, CEO of Zomato, has responded to user concerns about additional fees associated with enabling Veg Mode on the app, clarifying the practices around billing.

  • Users noticed extra charges on their bills when Veg Mode was activated.
  • Goyal emphasized the transparency of pricing in the app.
  • The company aims to enhance user experience by addressing feedback on features.
“We value customer feedback and are committed to ensuring clarity in our pricing structure.”

The reaction from users has catalyzed discussions about pricing fairness in food delivery apps.

summary:

Source: MotorOctane

The Hyundai Staria was recently introduced in India at Auto Expo 2025, showcasing its spacious interiors and modern features aimed at competing with the Kia Carnival.

  • Available initially in a 7-seat configuration.
  • Features a distinctive van-like design with LED DRL strip and large grille.

  • Includes a 10.25-inch touchscreen, digital driver display, and a Bose sound system.

title: RVNL shares jump 5% again today on Budget sops hopes, other railway stocks give up morning gains - Moneycontrol
summary:
RVNL Shares Surge on Union Budget Hopes

Date: January 17, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The RVNL stock has seen a significant increase, climbing 5% due to favorable expectations surrounding the upcoming Union Budget allocation.

  • RVNL stock surged 5% on January 17, building on an 11% gain from the previous day.
  • The increase is driven by hopes of substantial capital expenditure in the Union Budget 2025-2026, to be presented on February 1.
  • The Ministry of Railways received a record allocation of nearly Rs 2.62 lakh crore in the previous budget.
"Shares of railway stocks have seen heightened activity amid expectations of significant capex increment announcements."

This surge indicates investor optimism but also reflects the volatility of railway stocks in response to budget announcements.
newTitle: RVNL Shares Surge on Union Budget Hopes

Jio Financial Services Q3 Results Live Updates: Should you buy Jio Finance shares ahead of Q3 results today | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Jio Financial Services Q3 Results Live Updates: Should you buy Jio Finance shares ahead of Q3 results today

Date: 17 Jan, 2025

Source: Live Mint

Jio Financial Services is set to announce its Q3 results today, with the share price hovering flat after a significant drop in the past month. The company has experienced a 17% decrease in its stock over the last month, although it has gained 15% over the past year.

  • The stock has fallen 18% in one month.
  • Jio Financial Services reported a net profit of ₹689 crore for Q2FY25.
  • Revenue from operations rose 14% YoY to ₹693.5 crore in Q2FY25.
  • The firm has a market capitalization exceeding ₹1.76 lakh crore.
  • Analysts suggest the stock may be bottoming out and advise buying on dips.
“Jio Finance stock seems to be bottoming out. Traders can buy the stock on dips and at current market price. The first target is ₹300 and the second target is ₹305.” - Ganesh Dongre, Senior Manager - Technical Research at Anand Rathi

In conclusion, Jio Financial Services is expected to play a significant role in the non-banking finance sector. Investors are advised to observe the Q3 results closely, which are likely to influence the stock price moving forward.
newTitle: Jio Financial Services Q3 Results: Should You Buy Shares?

title: All New Toyota Fortuner Rival Unveiled At Auto Expo! - MotorOctane
summary:
MG Gloster 2025: The New Toyota Fortuner Rival Unveiled

Publication Date: Not specified Source: MotorOctane

The MG Gloster 2025 is officially unveiled, now renamed MG Majestor, aiming to compete with the Toyota Fortuner. This model features a new design and significant interior updates.

  • The MG Gloster is rebranded as MG Majestor.
  • It features a bold aggressive look with a refreshed design.
  • Notable interior updates include a larger touchscreen and captain seats.
  • Mechanically similar, it retains a 2.0-litre diesel engine with an 8-speed automatic gearbox.
  • Both 4X2 and 4X4 variants will be available.
“The Gloster is now Majestor. It seems, MG expects the Majestor to do the work which was remaining from Gloster (defeating Fortuner).”

This unveiling at the Auto Expo marks a significant step for MG as it targets a competitive segment in the SUV market.
newTitle: MG Gloster 2025: The New Toyota Fortuner Rival Unveiled

title: Kia Syros Showcased At Auto Expo 2025 Ahead Of Launch In February - CarDekho
summary:

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: CarDekho.com

The Kia Syros made its debut at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, showcasing its boxy design and upmarket features ahead of its launch in February 2025.

  • Bookings for the Kia Syros are open for a token amount of Rs 25,000.

title: India is staring at an 'oil shock' as U.S. sanctions on Russian crude loom - CNBC
summary:
India Faces Potential Oil Shock Due to U.S. Sanctions on Russian Crude

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: CNBC

India may soon face increased inflation and oil supply challenges due to U.S. sanctions targeting Russian energy companies.

  • U.S. sanctions on Russian oil transport may impact India's oil imports significantly.
  • India imported 40% of its oil from Russia, with expectations of price increases due to limited supply.
  • Impact on Indian refiners is likely to be severe, given the dependency on Russian crude.
  • India's oil consumption is projected to surpass China's by 2025, adding urgency to the situation.
“If India were to fully comply with U.S. sanctions, we could see a sharp decline in Russian crude arrivals in February and potentially March.” - Muyu Xu, Kpler

The ongoing situation highlights India's vulnerability to fluctuations in global oil markets and the potential for domestic economic strain.
newTitle: India Faces Potential Oil Shock Due to U.S. Sanctions on Russian Crude

title: 'Something Wrong In ED' : ASG SV Raju Disowns ED's Affidavit, Says It's Filed Without Verification;... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
ASG SV Raju Questions ED's Counter-Affidavit in Supreme Court

Date: January 17, 2023 | Source: Supreme Court proceedings

Additional Solicitor General SV Raju raised concerns regarding a counter-affidavit filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), claiming it was submitted without proper verification and consultation.

  • SV Raju describes the ED's affidavit as "half-baked" and questions its legitimacy.
  • He accuses the ED of filing the affidavit without verifying facts or consulting the investigatory agency.
  • The Supreme Court bench, comprising Justices Oka and Bhuyan, expressed surprise at these claims.
  • The ASG intends to investigate further and has requested a departmental inquiry into the matter.
  • Justice Oka questioned how the affidavit could be filed without proper instructions from the ED.
“There is something fishy in the filing of the affidavit that is what I found yesterday.” - ASG SV Raju

This situation highlights serious procedural concerns within the ED regarding the submission of legal documents.
newTitle: ASG SV Raju Questions ED's Counter-Affidavit in Supreme Court
